file_content.text: Doctor Meln? Doctor Ortis?
Doctor... Doctor Ortis. Just give me a minute to catch my breath. I thought that fight would never end.
Forgive him--this whole experience has been traumatic. Doctor Meln, at your service.
I can't believe you went to these lengths to rescue us. Thank you.
I was told you designed the Barrager. I hope I'm not wrong.
We need your help.
I didn't go that far.
The Empire imprisoned us because of the Barrager, and now the Republic's set us free. I think I know why you're here.
You're only free because the Republic needs you.
It's nothing personal.
I know how these things work. You want us to get you the Barrager.
The Barrager is an incredibly complicated and well-protected weapon, as designed. Luckily, our design notes are in contraband.
We can use Lieutenant Vekarr's credentials to override the security system and get those files. It'll lock down afterwards, of course, but we'll have what we need.
Can the override do anything else?
Give me all our options.
Change prison operations, security settings, nothing that's going to help us now.
These files must be as important as you are.
I'm surprised they survived.
When we were arrested, the Empire confiscated our research notes, our tools, our datapads--anything related to the Barrager.
For a prisoner, you know a lot about being a warden.
You've been paying attention.
Miserable worm was my boss for months. I got a firsthand view of how this place operates.
What good are the files?
If we have no reference, we can't guarantee this spike will work. The Barrager could behave erratically. It might not work at all.
You designed the Barrager, but you need a how-to book?
I thought you were experts.
The Barrager took years to design, and even longer to build. You can't expect us to have the whole thing memorized.
With our files, we can create a foolproof spike for the Republic, guaranteed to get control of the Barrager.
Wait just a minute. What about all those prisoners? You might have forgotten everything we've seen here, doctor, but I haven't.
This is our chance to destroy this terrible place. We have to use that override to let these people go. As for the Barrager... we'll figure out something.
The Gorinth Brig's caused enough suffering.
Free the prisoners.
You may have just single-handedly condemned the Republic.
The thanks of a thousand prisoners should make up for it. The override worked. Every security field in the Gorinth Brig has failed.
We should get to a shuttle. Doctor Meln and I will do our best to get something together for the Barrager spike. Thank you.
There can't be any question marks on this mission, no matter what the cost.
Get the Barrager files.
Let me just input the override... there! Years of research and data, back in our hands.
You shameless opportunist. I'll help, but only to get rid of the Empire.
We'll get to the nearest Republic shuttle pad and have this ready within the hour. It's been a pleasure.
Thank you for rescuing us. I'm going to try my best to forget this place.
